metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18541 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Teeworlds before 0.6.5, connection packets could be forged. There was no challenge-response involved in the connection build up. A remote attacker could send connection packets from a spoofed IP address and occupy all server slots, or even use them for a reflection attack using map download packets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-18541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

teeworlds - 0.7.0-1
teeworlds-data - 0.7.0-1
teeworlds-server - 0.7.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: teeworlds package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.0-1').
